comments.body: Based on the `render()` method in the material-ui source code, since `tfoot` is passed all `other`  properties, use `React.HTMLAttributesBase<TableFooter>` instead of `HasStyleAndClassNameProps`.
Based on the `render()` method in the material-ui source code, since `th` is passed all `other`  properties, use `React.HTMLAttributesBase<TableHeaderColumn>` instead of `HasStyleAndClassNameProps`.
Based on the `render()` method in the material-ui source code, since `tr` is passed all `other`  properties, use `React.HTMLAttributesBase<TableRow>` instead of `HasStyleAndClassNameProps`.
Based on the `render()` method in the material-ui source code, since `td` is passed all `other`  properties, use `React.HTMLAttributesBase<TableRowColumn>` instead of `HasStyleAndClassNameProps`.
Why not just return a standard `Classdecorator`?
